title: Reactive pg datasource with enabled health check opens more connections than configured
body:
### Describe the bug

We use the reactive postgresql datasource, with configured max-size and enabled datasource health check.

### Expected behavior

The maximum number of open connections are equals the configured number.

### Actual behavior

The number of open database connections increases to twice the maximum number configured.

### How to Reproduce?

1. Create a simple app with reactive postgresql datasource and datasource health check (quarkus create app  --extension='resteasy-reactive,reactive-pg-client,resteasy-reactive-jackson,smallrye-health')
2. Configure max-size (quarkus.datasource.reactive.max-size=5)
3. Enable health check (quarkus.datasource.health.enabled=false)
4. Create an endpoint with database access
5. Call this endpoint and the health endpoint a view times (for example with apache benchmark)
6. Check the open connections in your database

Small reproducer can be found here: https://github.com/dgewiss/quarkus-reactive-health-check-test

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk 21 2023-09-19 LTS

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.7.4

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.6

### Additional information

This workaround works for me:

Disable the datasource health check and use a own implementation of ReactivePgDataSourcesHealthCheck.

The difference to the original implementation is that `io.vertx.mutiny.pgclient.PgPool` is used to select the connection pool instead of `io.vertx.pgclient.PgPool`. The delegate is then passed to the ReactiveDatasourceHealthCheck.

This workraound is also incuded in the reproducer.
